definition: a short time/a little while
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
all of a sudden/drizzle
the passage of the years/the flow of time
the sun and moon like a shuttle (idiom); How time flies!
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
a snap of the fingers (idiom); in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
lit. (cloud shapes) changing from a white shirt to a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
to enumerate what is black and yellow (idiom); to criticize sb behind his back to incite quarrels/also written 數黑論黃|数黑论黄[shu3 hei1 lun4 huang2]
flowering autumn grass, fine net (idiom); fig. abundant and exacting punishments prescribed by law
(literary) wailing/choking with sobs
to delay/to stretch out/to play for time
waiting anxiously (idiom)
lit. the goose comes, the swallow goes (idiom); fig. always on the move
flash of lightning, morning dew (idiom); fig. ephemeral/impermanent
without news from sb (idiom)
out of one's mind
lit. the sun setting and the moon rising (idiom)/fig. the passage of time
in a flash/in a jiffy
